ca.ualberta.lard.model

Class Comment

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.lard.model.Comment

  • public class Comment
extends Object
    An instance of Comment represents a comment a user creates to share her thoughts about a particular location. Every comment has a generated id, a GeoLocation, an author, the date it was created, the most recent date it was updated, and a body text. It may or may not have a picture. The CommentController can be used to retrieve lists of Comments in a sorted order and the DataModel can be used to save a Comment. Comments can use to DataModel to request information about it, such as if it has children or if it is saved locally.
    Author:
    Victoria

      • getParent

        public Comment getParent()
        Returns null if the comment does not have a parent, so the parent comment cannot be retrieved. Otherwise, the parent comment is returned.
        Returns:
        null or the parent Comment

      • children

        public ArrayList<Comment> children()
        Returns null is a comment has no children. Otherwise returns the children in a ArrayList. Children should be sorted by date created.
        Returns:
        null or ArrayList of children

      • setBodyText

        public void setBodyText(String bodyText)
        Sets the text of the comment. If an empty input is given the text will be set to [Comment Text Removed] by default.
        Parameters:
        bodyText -

      • setAuthor

        public void setAuthor(String username,
             Context context)
        Sets the author of the comment. The author will be the user name appended with a hash unique to the device being used. If an empty user name or no name is given author will be set to Anonymous by default.
        Parameters:
        username -
        context -

      • numReplies

        public int numReplies()
        Returns an integer. The number of children is 0 if the list of children is null. Otherwise the number of elements in the list of children is returned.
        Returns:
        Number of children

      • isLocal

        public boolean isLocal(Context context)
        Returns true if the comment is saved locally and false if it is not.
        Returns:
        true or false
